messageValues.message:
=# Role
You You're an employe of a Swiss Company responsible for Invoice Classification.

## TASK
Analyze the following invoice or financial document text and classify it accordingly.  
Decide if each item is an **Investment** (Balance Sheet/Assets) or an **Expense** (Income Statement).

## Output
A json based on the schema with following keys:

parameters.text:
=<parsed-document-content>
{{ $json['processed_attachments.data'].textForLLM }}
</parsed-document-content>

Classify this document and extract all available data.

messageValues.message:
=You are an AI invoice processor for a Swiss SaaS company. You classify documents and extract their data.

## YOUR TASKS (in order):
1. **Classify** the document type and accounting category
2. **Extract** all invoice data into structured fields

## CLASSIFICATION RULES:
- Revenue: Customer invoices we send
- Expense: Invoices/receipts we receive from suppliers
- Invoice: Formal billing document with invoice number
- Receipt: Proof of payment (often simpler, may lack invoice #)

## EXTRACTION RULES:
- Use **snake_case** keys in English
- Prioritize standard keys: invoice_number, invoice_date, supplier_name, recipient_business_name, total_amount_due, currency_code, due_date, line_items, etc.
- For line items: array of objects with item_description, quantity, unit_price, line_item_total
- Only include keys for data that existsâ€”do not invent values
- If unsure about a field's purpose, prefix with `uncertain_`

## OUTPUT:
JSON only. No explanations.

parameters.content:
## Auto-File Email Attachments to Google Drive

Reads email attachment content, extracts key data to determine filing location (Accounting/2025/May/Expense/), and records details to Google Sheets.

### How it works
1. Monitors Gmail for new emails with attachments
2. Classifies documents (invoice, receipt, confirmation, newsletter, etc.)
   - *any-file2json-converter*: Extracts text from PDFs, images (OCR), and documents
3. For financial documents, extracts structured data and verifies sender
4. Files attachments to organized Google Drive folders (Accounting/2025/05_May/Expense/)
   - *google-drive-folder-id-lookup*: Locates or creates correct folder structure
5. Logs invoice details to Google Sheets
6. Sends notifications via Telegram

### Setup
- [ ] Import all 5 workflows (1 main + 2 subworkflows + 1 recursive + 1 batch processor)
- [ ] Connect Google OAuth (Gmail + Drive + Sheets)
- [ ] Add AI provider credentials (Groq or Gemini)
- [ ] Create Google Sheet named "2505_Invoices" with required columns
- [ ] Download and upload folder structure template to Google Drive
- [ ] Configure sender whitelist: add your own email address to test
- [ ] Activate Gmail trigger

- [ ] Test: forward an existing invoice email with attachments to yourself

---
#### After First Run
- [ ] Run `gmail-systematic-processor` workflow to clean up and process all existing emails/attachments in your inbox for a truly organized system (the Gmail trigger only catches new incoming emails)
- [ ] Connect Telegram bot for notifications

---
ðŸ“‚ **[View full docs & source code on GitHub â†’](https://github.com/runfish5/micro-services/tree/main/projects/n8n/3_inbox-attachment-organizer)**

Options:
a. Deactivate with `ctrl + d`.
b. **Follow n8n instructions on how to use the telegram node.** [DOCs](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/app-nodes/n8n-nodes-base.telegram/?utm_source=n8n_app&utm_medium=node_settings_modal-credential_link&utm_campaign=n8n-nodes-base.telegram)

**Set the id of your preferred root directory.**
It should be the one thats called "Accounting" in the template. Open it in the browser and take the last section of the URL, for example: `https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1tiI-FHH-yeWju4gS`, then just copy-paste `1tiI-FHH-yeWju4gS` in this woflow field `'root_folder_id'`
Connect to the created google sheet.
